stories.text:
I was on an Apple QA interview yesterday, and I was asked to design a stack, which can do push and pop, and should have O(1) complexity to find the minimum value.

I couldn't solve the problem, so after the interview, I looked up Google and found this:

https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/design-a-stack-that-supports-getmin-in-o1-time-and-o1-extra-space/

I wonder how you come up with such a solution when given the problem. It seems just incredible.
stories.title: How do you guys come up with such an algorithm

stories.text:
Now that more of the world has been remotely working for a while, I'm sure teams have tried tons of different tools, processes, communication styles, etc to fix some of the difficulties of remote work and collaboration.

What did you try and were disappointed by?

What did you try and were surprised by?

If you were to blank sheet a remote company today, what is your "remote stack"?
stories.title: Ask HN: What has and has not worked for remote work in 2022?
